im lying in a hospital im pinned against the bed a stethoscope upon my heart a hand against my head theyre peeling off the bandages im wincing in the light the nurse is looking anxious and shes quivering in fright im looking through gary gilmores eyes the doctors are avoiding me my vision is confused i listen to my earphones and i catch the evening news a murderers been killed and he donates his sight to science im locked into a private ward i realise that i must be looking through gary gilmores eyes looking through gary gilmores eyes i smash the light in anger push my bed against the door i close my lids across my eyes and wish to see no more the eye receives the messages and sends them to the brain no guarantee the stimuli must be perceived the same when looking through gary gilmores eyes gary dont need his eyes to see gary and his eyes have parted company
